title: The Metamorphosis
creator: Franz Kafka
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of The Metamorphosis by Franz Kafka. Read by David Richardson "The Metamorphosis" is a novella by Franz Kafka, first published in 1915 and one of his best known works. The story begins with a traveling salesman, Gregor Samsa, waking to find himself transformed into a horrible verminous creature. Terrifying in its banal simplicity, it became one of the seminal works of the twentieth century. This Translation is by Ian Johnston. (Summary by David Richardson) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. Download M4B (64MB)
subject: librivox; audiobooks; 20th century literature; fiction; Insect; Transformation; Metamorphosis; Kafka; novella

reviews.reviewbody: David Richardson's Metamorphosis is an elegant, nuanced reading, a real pleasure to listen to.
